abstract: A conversation with the former Colombian finance minister, one of two challengers to the Obama administration’s nominee.
snippet: A conversation with the former Colombian finance minister, one of two challengers to the Obama administration’s nominee.
lead_paragraph: Last week, I spoke with two candidates for the presidency of the World Bank for an article on the contested election, the first in the history of the Washington-based development institution. (The White House has nominated Dr. Jim Yong Kim, a global health expert and the president of Dartmouth College.) Both candidates gave detailed answers on how they would lead the bank and why they are running for the presidency.

headline.main: Why José Antonio Ocampo Wants to Run the World Bank
